* Process improvement to increase data quality and working efficiency.



**What we are looking for:** 



* Graduate in Business, Accounting, Industrial Engineering & Management or equivalent.
* At least 2 years’ relevant professional experience within financial accounting, business controlling or similar.
* Strong analytical skills and the ability to turn analysis into actions.
* Great team player and communication skills.
* Results driven and self-going.
* Excellent IT Skills, efficient in excel and powerBI.
* Fluent in English, both written and verbally. Scandinavian language skills are highly meritorious.



 You have an inquisitive nature and are not afraid to ask questions. As a person you are accurate and pay attention to detail. Being motivated, organised and proactive comes naturally to you.
 



  





  





**What we offer:** 




 Konecranes is committed to the personal development of all its employees. An attractive remuneration/benefits package is offered including a good base salary (dependent on experience), bonus, contributory pension, and life assurance scheme. Support in Furthering the Candidates studies through Financial Qualifications.
 



  





 The position is full-time
 



  





**Placement: See possible office locations below:** 




 Denmark: Copenhagen or Vejle
 



 Sweden: Stockholm or Kristianstad
 



 Norway: Oslo, Bergen or Fredrikstad
 



  





 Occasional travel is to be expected.
 



  





**Do you want to take Konecranes to the next level? Warm welcome with your application!** 




  





  





  





 Konecranes is a global leader in material handling solutions, serving a broad range of customers across multiple industries. We consistently set the industry benchmark, from everyday improvements to the breakthroughs at moments that matter most, because we know we can always find a safer, more productive and sustainable way. That's why, with 16 000+ professionals in over 50 countries, we are trusted every day to lift, handle and move what the world needs.
 



  





 Konecranes is committed to ensuring that all employees and job applicants are treated fairly in an environment which is free from any form of discrimination.

title: Codebeamer Consultant / Manager
description:
Accenture is a leading global professional services company, providing a broad range of services in strategy and consulting, interactive, technology and operations, with digital capabilities across all these services. With our thought leadership and culture of innovation, we apply industry expertise, diverse skill sets and next-generation technology to each business challenge.
   

  

 We believe in inclusion and diversity and supporting the whole person. Our core values comprise of Stewardship, Best People, Client Value Creation, One Global Network, Respect for the Individual and Integrity. Year after year, Accenture is recognized worldwide not just for business performance but for inclusion and diversity too.
   

  

 At the Industry X business group we embed innovation, intelligence, and sustainability in the way the world makes things and the things it makes. Industry X enables leaders to act quickly and confidently as they pivot to the future. We define Industry X as digital reinvention of manufacturing / engineering and believe that smart, sustainable, connected digital products and assets are about to create hyper-personalised industrial experiences, completely new levels of operational efficiency, transparency and traceability, tangible impact on sustainability and brand-new sources of revenue growth. Known for our ability to execute at speed, we help clients determine clear, actionable paths to competitive agility by bringing them new thinking on business and technology.
   

  

**Position Overview:** 
 As a Codebeamer Consultant/Manager, you will play a crucial role in implementing and managing Codebeamer for our clients. You will work closely with cross-functional teams to ensure the successful deployment and utilization of Codebeamer in various engineering and software lifecycle management projects.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities:**
- Implement and configure Codebeamer for clients, ensuring it meets their specific needs and requirements.

- Provide training and support to clients on the effective use of Codebeamer.

- Collaborate with clients to understand their engineering processes, including Product Lifecycle Management (PLM) and mechanical engineering.

- Assist in the integration of Codebeamer with other tools and systems within the client’s PTS portfolio.

- Manage and oversee the software lifecycle management processes, ensuring best practices are followed.

- Stay up-to-date with the latest developments in Codebeamer and related technologies.

**Qualifications:**
- Master’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or related field.

- Previous working experience with Codebeamer tool.

- Strong understanding of software lifecycle management.

- Familiarity with engineering processes such as PLM and mechanical engineering.

- Ability to work independently and as part of a team.

- Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail.

**What We Offer:**
- A dynamic environment where you can develop and hone your consulting skills.

- Opportunities to work on transformative projects across various industries.

- Access to the latest tools and technologies.

- A supportive community of experts dedicated to innovation and excellence.

- Opportunities to grow together with the company.

 If you are passionate and eager to drive innovation in a dynamic, forward-thinking company, we would love to hear from you!

title: Sales Executive, Siemens Digital Industries Software
description:
Eviden, part of the Atos Group, with an annual revenue of circa € 5 billion is a global leader in data-driven, trusted and sustainable digital transformation. As a next generation digital business with worldwide leading positions in digital, cloud, data, advanced computing and security, it brings deep expertise for all industries in more than 47 countries. By uniting unique high-end technologies across the full digital continuum with 47,000 world-class talents, Eviden expands the possibilities of data and technology, now and for generations to come.
 



  





  





 Eviden is investing in the Nordics. Our ambition is to implement heavy business growth across Nordics countries and become a Leader in empowering industrial customers with unwavering adaptability and industrial excellence​. The hearth of our Nordics strategy is to build a local manufacturing center of excellence, to become a preferred partner for industrial companies in the Nordics.
 



  





  





 We are dedicated to innovating together with our clients and partners to enhance the design, manufacturing, sales, and service of products, serving our clients securely and sustainably.
 



  





**Position overview:** 




  





 Eviden is the largest Siemens software reseller in the Nordics. We have built our expertise spanning nearly 30 years in the industry and have a strong team of experts in Scandinavia and the Baltics. Siemens's partnership is a strategic choice for us. We are at the forefront of digital transformation and cloud services, and we are seeking Sales Specialists for our Manufacturing Center of Excellence in the Nordics.
 



  





 Your mission: As a Sales Executive, you will join our Siemens Digital Industries Software sales team and focus on selling Siemens software and services to industrial clients in the region. Your goal is to position Siemens Digital Industries Software as the preferred technology and Eviden as a trusted advisor in PLM, MOM, and Product/Production Simulation areas. The main focus is to land new customers.
 



  





***We will consider candidates based in the following locations: Finland, Sweden, Denmark, or Norway***




  





**As a key contributor to our growth in the Nordics, your responsibilities include:** 




  




* Strategize and penetrate large accounts with a focus on Siemens Digital Industries Software portfolio and you will be working with highly skilled professionals working in SAP, digital security, smart platforms, and manufacturing domains.
* Accrue and deploy customer insights, driving business transformation and reducing customer costs and risks.
* Lead with product and industry insights, best practices, and compelling business cases, establishing Eviden as a tier 1 industry partner and a trusted advisor.
* Manage customer relationships with integrity, driving satisfaction and positioning Eviden as a leader in innovation and service delivery.
* Leverage your existing network to land new customers in our Siemens Digital Industries Software offerings.
* Build a broad influential network amongst your clients to create additional opportunities to expand our footprint in the accounts.
* Engage prospects and provide strategic recommendations that position our products and services to advance the customer’s strategic initiatives and deliver mutual value.
* Work closely with marketing to improve our position in the market and harness your digital sales and marketing skills to drive new sales leads.
* Build and own your sales territory plan and execute the plan by leading our pre-sales consultants and marketing team.








**Qualifications:** 




  




* Passion for industrial digitalization and experience and understanding of industrial value chain.
* 5+ years of experience in enterprise software sales, sales enablement, business development, software industry operations
* Experience in value-based sales methodologies
* Proven track record of success in selling complex technical software solutions and building strong qualified pipeline in systematic way.
* Skill in identifying key stakeholders and decision-makers, establishing long-term relationships of trust, credibility, and respect.
* Strong work ethic: Team player, self-starter, high energy, and results oriented.
* Excellent communication and presentation skills in English, both verbal and written, is mandatory. A fluent local language (Finnish, Swedish, Norwegian) is considered as a large benefit.








**What we offer:** 




  




* A role in a unique technology powerhouse with a strong local and global presence and a commitment to driving sustainability and environmental programs.
* Opportunities for growth within a company that values learning, agility, and customer obsession.
* You will have a unique opportunity to witness heavy business expansion and you are essential contributor for the growth.



  





**Let’s grow together.**

title: UX/UI Designer
description:
**UX/UI Designer to Edenred!** 




  





 Edenred Sweden wants to bring joy to the working world, and we are convinced that happy employees create happy companies. That’s why we offer “må bra”-accounts which employers can fill with benefits within food, wellness, and gifts. We call it” Sunshine in your wallet” and now we are searching for a new colleague who can help us shine.
 




 Is this you?
 





  
 




**Are you passionate about creating exceptional user experiences?** 







 We are looking for a creative and driven UX/UI Designer who is eager to take on the main responsibility for driving and developing design processes and owning the entire design process from user research to pixel-perfect design.
 





 In this role you will work closely with our other UX/UI-designer, our product managers, product owners, developers & QA:s. You will report to the Marketing, Product & Innovation Director for Sweden.
 





  
 





  
 




**Do you want to do this?** 





 ·      Drive and develop design processes, taking ownership of the entire design process from user research to pixel-perfect design
 





 ·      Map and enhance user needs by understanding their motivations and requirements
 





 ·      Plan, conduct, and analyze interviews, user tests, and A/B tests to optimize user experiences
 





 ·      Create wireframes, evaluate and iterate designs, and develop UI for our products
 





 ·      Formulate hypotheses and ideas based on user insights, collaborating with internal and external stakeholders and holding workshops to understand user needs and requirements
 





 ·      Collaborate effectively with various teams across the organization, from product owners to developers, customer service, marketing, and sales
 





 ·      Have a significant influence over the product and processes
 





  
 





  
 




**We believe that you:** 





 ·      3+ years of experience in modern product development with a strong focus on UX and UI, preferably including working with complex systems such as banking or financial systems
 





 ·      Have proficiency in working with tools such as Figma and JIRA
 





 ·      Relevant degree or equivalent practical experience in UX/UI design, human-computer interaction, graphic design, or a related field
 





 ·      Have a proven track record of effectively collaborating with developers, product owners and QA:s to seamlessly transition design concepts into development, ensuring alignment with business objectives and user needs
 





 ·      Are fluent in Swedish and English
 





 ·      Are familiar with designing for accessibility
 





 ·      Stay up-to-date of potential changes in legal requirements
 





  
 




**As a person you are** 





 ·      Creative & innovative
 





 ·      Structured, with a clear working process
 





 ·      Analytical – adept at interpreting insights, prioritizing clearly, and understanding and communicating the consequences of these insights
 





 ·      Communicative, collaborative, and skilled at fostering teamwork
 





 ·      Results-driven, methodical and structured in your design process
 





 ·      Operational and strategic with a genuine focus on qualitative customer experience
 





  
 









**What we offer** 





 ·      Collective agreement and flexible working hours
 





 ·      The possibility to choose hybrid between office and distance work
 





 ·      A “må-bra-konto” with contribution for lunch and wellness allowances
 





 ·      A work culture where we hold diversity and inclusion in high regard, self-evidently also in our recruitment processes
 





 ·      If you ask us, a lot of fun and very great colleagues!
 




  











**We process applications continuously, welcome with your application!**

title: Biträdande säkerhetschef
description:
På
 **Alstom** 
 förstår vi transportsystem och vad som sätter människor i rörelse. Från höghastighetståg, tunnelbanor, monorails och spårvagnar till nyckelfärdiga system, tjänster, infrastruktur, signalering och digital mobilitet, erbjuder vi våra mångsidiga kunder den bredaste portföljen i branschen. Varje dag leder 80 000 kollegor vägen till grönare och smartare mobilitet över hela världen, kopplar samman städer samtidigt som vi minskar koldioxidutsläpp och ersätter bilar.
   

  

 Alstom är den största aktören på den svenska järnvägsmarknaden, med över 1000 levererade tåg och har flera stora underhållskontrakt samt erbjuder underhåll i 19 lokala depåer. Företaget leder också ERTMS-utbyggnaden i Sverige, både ombord och längs spåren, och levererar det nya nationella trafikledningssystemet för Trafikverket.
   

  

 Är du redo att tillämpa din omfattande säkerhets expertis inom ett banbrytande område?
   

  

**Alstom** 
 söker en
 **Biträdande säkerhetschef** 
 för Sverige,
   

  

 som kommer att vara baserad i
 **Stockholm** 
 .
   

  

**Din framtida roll**
 Genom att rapportera direkt till vår chef för fastigheter och säkerhet kommer du att ha en avgörande roll i Alstoms säkerhetsoperationer, både som utförare och planerare. Du kommer att ansvara för att skapa en säker miljö för våra människor, tillgångar och verksamheter genom att övervaka säkerhetspolicyer, rutiner och operationer inom vårt företag i Sverige. Rollen innebär betydande samverkan med seniora medarbetare, vilket förstärker den strategiska betydelsen av denna roll.
   

  

 Fastigheter och säkerhet är en tvärfunktionell avdelning ansvarig för alla fastighets- och säkerhetsrelaterade frågor för alla Alstoms platser i Sverige. Vi är för närvarande 7 permanenta teammedlemmar och vi har våra entreprenörer/leverantörer för säkerhet, hård och mjuk FM och andra tjänster inom vårt ansvarsområde. Chefen för fastigheter och säkerhet är också Alstom Sveriges säkerhets- och säkerhetsskyddschef.
   

  

**Nyckelansvar:**
**Översyn av policy och rutiner:** 
 Utveckla och implementera robusta säkerhetsåtgärder för att skydda Alstoms människor, tillgångar, platser, projekt och känslig information.
   

  

**Krisberedskap:** 
 Bidra till klustrets prestation och värdeskapande genom att etablera och verkställa krisberedskapsprocesser.
   

  

**Ledarskap och ställföreträdande:** 
 Agera som ställföreträdare för säkerhetschefen, kliva in och representera vid behov. Engagera dig ofta med seniora chefer inom företaget.
   

  

**Proaktiva och reaktiva åtgärder:** 
 Övervaka och hantera alla säkerhetsåtgärder, både proaktiva och reaktiva, för att skydda Alstom mot olika illvilliga handlingar.
   

  

**Vi förväntar oss av dig:**
* Stödja den övergripande strategiska och taktiska hanteringen av Alstoms säkerhetspolicy i Sverige.
* Bedöma interna och externa hot och identifiera samt mildra säkerhetsriskerna för Sverige.
* Säkerställa efterlevnad av alla erforderliga säkerhetsåtgärder inom landet i linje med de etablerade säkerhetspolicyerna från Chief Security Office.
* Se till att Alstom följer relevanta regler.
* Assistera HR med bakgrundskontroller av personal.
* Utföra kontinuerliga hotbedömningar (illvilliga handlingar mot Alstoms människor, platser, projekt och verksamheter) för att etablera effektiva förebyggande åtgärder genom platsbedömningar, säkerhetsplaner och implementering och uppföljning av säkerhetsåtgärder.
* Tjäna som ställföreträdare för säkerhetschefen med ansvar för Sverige.
* Deltaga i kommersiella upphandlingsprocesser inom landet och bidra till kostnadseffektiviteten i säkerhetsleveransen i Sverige.
* Överse och följa upp leveransen av externa säkerhetskontrakt.
* Ge råd och rekommendationer till chefen för fastigheter och säkerhet samt Alstoms ledning om säkerhetsrelaterade frågor och säkerställa samordning med alla säkerhetsintressenter (externa och interna).
* Implementera säkerhetsåtgärder för att säkerställa säkerheten för resenärer som kommer till och från Sverige i samarbete med Chief Security Office.
* Delta i interna revisioner och skapa nödvändig dokumentation.
* Genomföra säkerhetsträning med anställda och entreprenörer.
* Skapa och upprätthålla effektiva arbetsrelationer med säkerhetsnätverket inom landet (säkerhetsleverantörer, säkerhetschefer från andra nationella eller internationella företag).
* Stödja implementeringen av landets krisberedskapsprocedurer i enlighet med koncernens säkerhetspolicy (utbildning; planering). Hantera säkerhetskriser och allvarliga incidenter inom Sverige.
* Organisera skyddet av Alstoms viktiga evenemang i landet (möten, evenemang) genom att implementera adekvata säkerhetsåtgärder i förväg för att förhindra oönskade incidenter.
* Anta en verklig partnerskapsmetod för problemlösning och riskminimering.


 I det dagliga arbetet kommer du effektivt att balansera behoven hos arbetsplatsen, anställda och nyckelintressenter samtidigt som du upprätthåller fokus på compliance. Vi stöder alla varandra i vårt team med arbetet.
   

  

**Allt om dig** 
 Vi värdesätter passion och attityd tillsammans med erfarenhet. Därför förväntar vi oss inte att du har varje enda färdighet. Istället har vi listat några som hjälper dig att lyckas och växa i denna roll:
   

  

**Nyckelegenskaper:**
* Expertis: Dokumenterad erfarenhet inom säkerhetshantering, med en bevisad erfarenhet av att övervaka omfattande säkerhetsoperationer.
* Ledarskap: Starka ledarskapsförmågor, kapabel att vägleda och vara ställföreträdande för säkerhetschefen samt samordna och stödja ett nätverk av säkerhetskoordinatorer (inte säkerhetsspecialister) vid våra siter utan att ha ett personalansvar.
* Kommunikationsförmåga: Utmärkta interpersonella färdigheter, med förmågan att effektivt kommunicera, samarbeta och påverka våra chefer och kollegor.
* Krisberedskapskompetens: Skicklig i att utveckla och genomföra krisberedskapsprotokoll.


**För att övervägas för denna roll behöver du ha följande:**
**Väsentliga krav:**
* Betydande och relevant erfarenhet inom brottsbekämpning/försvarsmakt och/eller säkerhetsrelaterade kvalifikationer (CSMP/CPP välkomnas) eller motsvarande yrkeserfarenhet inom ett relaterat område.
* Omfattande kunskap om nationella säkerhetsmiljöer och säkerhetsfrågor.
* Erfarenhet av att hantera komplexa projekt med snäva tidsramar och budgetbegränsningar.
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta i en multikulturell miljö inom en komplex matrisorganisation.
* Avancerade Microsoft Office-färdigheter (Excel, PowerPoint, Word).
* Bakgrund inom partnersamarbete och problemlösning.
* Förståelse för skillnaden mellan strategisk, taktisk och operativ leverans.
* Flytande svenska (talad och skriven) samt goda kunskaper i talad och skriven engelska, eftersom detta är vårt företags språk.


**Önskvärt:**
* Genomfört Försvarshögskolans grundkurs i skyddad säkerhet eller annan relevant kurs som Alstom bedömer som relevant.
* Examination som säkerhetssamordnare eller beredskaps- och säkerhetssamordnare, 2 års YH-utbildning.
* Skicklig i att genomföra skyddade säkerhetsintervjuer.
* Erfarenhet av krisberedskapsövningar / bildande av krisgrupper.
* Stark erfarenhet av att presentera för stora, seniora målgrupper.
* Teknisk säkerhetserfarenhet, t.ex. CCTV, PIDS, AACS.
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta inom en reglerad och komplex miljö.
* Erfarenhet inom den privata sektorn med kommersiellt ansvar och hantering av budgetar.
* IT-säkerhetsutbildning/träning.


**Eftersom rollen rör säkerhetskänsliga aktiviteter och säkerhetsklassificerad information krävs det att du genomgår en säkerhetsprövning innan anställning kan ske.**
**Varför Alstom?** 
 Att ansluta sig till oss innebär att vara en del av ett team som är dedikerat till innovation, excellens och att skapa en säker miljö för vår verksamhet. Om du har den expertis och drivkraft som krävs för att ta dig an denna utmaning, bjuder vi in dig att ansöka och bli en nyckelperson i Alstoms framtida säkerhetslandskap.
   

  

**Det här kommer du att uppskatta:** 
 Gå med oss på en livslång transformationsresa – järnvägsindustrin är här för att stanna, så du kan växa och utveckla nya färdigheter och erfarenheter under hela din karriär.
   

  

 Du kommer också att:
   

  

* Glädjas av stabilitet, utmaningar och en långsiktig karriär utan tråkiga dagliga rutiner.
* Samarbeta med tvärfunktionella team och hjälpsamma kollegor.
* Bidra till innovativa projekt.
* Utnyttja vår flexibla arbetsmiljö.
* Dra nytta av vår investering i din utveckling genom prisbelönt lärande.
* Få en rättvis och dynamisk belöningspaket som erkänner din prestation och potential.


 Du behöver inte vara en tågentusiast för att trivas med oss. Vi garanterar att när du kliver på ett av våra tåg med dina vänner eller familj, kommer du att känna stolthet. Om du är redo för utmaningen, vill vi gärna höra från dig!
   

  

**Vad vi erbjuder:** 
 Vi erbjuder ett mycket konkurrenskraftigt ersättnings paket, inklusive en prestationsbaserad bonus, 30 dagars årlig ledighet plus allmänna helgdagar. Bidrag till hälso- och sjukvård, livförsäkring, en utmärkt företagsbidragen pensionsplan, samt ett brett utbud av flexibla förmåner som du kan skräddarsy efter din livsstil.
   

  

 Är du redo att gå med i ett verkligt internationellt samhälle av fantastiska människor på en utmanande resa med påtaglig påverkan och syfte?

title: Customer Success Manager – Super iPaaS
description:
**Introduction**
 A Customer Success Manager Architect (CSM) career in IBM means a career where you're helping clients fully realise the value of their existing IBM products, whilst growing their adoption of next-generation technologies from across IBM's wider portfolio. It means being a trusted strategic advisor to some of the world's most transformational enterprises and culturally influential brands, as they rely on your expertise and our technology to solve some of their hardest problems.
   

  

 Excellent onboarding and an industry leading learning culture will set you up for positive impact and success, whilst ongoing development will advance your career through an upward trajectory. Our sales environment is collaborative and experiential. Part of a team, you'll be surrounded by bright minds and keen co-creators – always willing to help and be helped – as you apply passion to work that will have a positive impact to the world around us.
   

  

**Your Role and Responsibilities**
 A Customer Success Manager opportunity in IBM might be different to what you're used to. In addition to the people and commercial skills often associated with this position, an IBM CSM is also an Architect. Someone with a deep understanding of technical complexities. A person who can quickly understand clients' hard-to-understand technology issue and communicate them back in an easy-to-understand way.
   

  

 With deep roots in a hands-on technological background, and through different communication techniques, you'll be able to showcase IBM solutions. Using excellent communication, you'll articulate their compatibilities with a client's stack via use-case identification, solution architecture design, and MVP builds.
   

  

 With technical expertise and a consultative style, you'll quickly build credibility as a trusted advisor at all levels. To drive expansion and renewal growth, you'll guide IT executives through the changes needed to realise the full value of expanding their adoption of IBM's products.
   

  

**Your Primary Responsibilities Will Include**
* Understanding Client's Challenges and Building Trust: Understand clients' primary challenges and establish yourself as a trusted technical expert for their migration, deployment, and adoption of Hybrid Cloud and AI Growth offerings.
* Facilitating Use Case Exploration and Business Framing: Lead use case exploration and business framing workshops, develop client value realization models.
* Leading Persuasive Technical Conversations: Lead technical discussions that persuade clients to act based on their requirements and the value provided by IBM's solutions.
* Creating Post-Deployment Customer Success Plans: Develop post-deployment customer success plans aimed at continually increasing post-launch, active user adoption of IBM's products.


**Required Technical and Professional Expertise**
* Proven Technical Expertise in Complex Technology Sales: Demonstrated track record as a technical expert (e.g., Engineer or equivalent) in successfully closed Technology sales cycles.
* Hands-On Experience in Technology Domains: A previous background with hands-on practical experience in one of the following areas: Cloud, Data and AI, Automation, Integration or Security, enabling rapid establishment of credible trust with client stakeholders.
* Proficiency in Agile Practices: Solid experience in utilizing agile best practices to achieve successful outcomes in an agile and swift manner.
* Effective Communication and Relationship Building: Demonstrable success in communicating and personal relationship development at all levels, from engineers to CIOs.
* Self-Motivation and Problem-Solving Aptitude: A natural inclination toward self-motivation and initiative, in addition to the ability to navigate data and people to find answers and present solutions.
* Prior success in a customer-facing role such as customer success, consulting, pre-sales, technical account management, or equivalent functions
* Several years of professional experience with complex software and IT solutions (Cloud and SaaS solutions) or in supporting customers in an integration environment
* Track record of achieving targets and goals/quotas
* Ability to lead technical/in-depth conversations
* Handled difficult customer situations and escalations
* Willingness and ability to travel as required to spend time with customers
* Business fluent in English
* Experience with using or implementing webMethods (or a similarly mature product)


**Preferred Technical And Professional Expertise**
* Broad Technology Solution Expertise: Proven experience working with a diverse range of technology solutions, including Cloud, Data & AI, and more (training in IBM's products will be provided).
* Sales Experience in Software and Cloud: Demonstrated experience in software and Cloud sales, encompassing software, SaaS, IaaS, PaaS, and Cloud solutions.
* Ability to speak another language besides English (nice to have)


**About Business Unit**
 IBM has a global presence, operating in more than 175 countries with a broad-based geographic distribution of revenue. The company’s Global Markets organization is a strategic sales business unit that manages IBM’s global footprint, working closely with dedicated country-based operating units to serve clients locally. These country teams have client relationship managers who lead integrated teams of consultants, solution specialists and delivery professionals to enable clients’ growth and innovation. By complementing local expertise with global experience and digital capabilities, IBM builds deep and broad-based client relationships. This local management focus fosters speed in supporting clients, addressing new markets and making investments in emerging opportunities. Additionally, the Global Markets organization serves clients with expertise in their industry as well as through the products and services that IBM and partners supply. IBM is also expanding its reach to new and existing clients through digital marketplaces.
   

  

**Your Life @ IBM**
 In a world where technology never stands still, we understand that, dedication to our clients success, innovation that matters, and trust and personal responsibility in all our relationships, lives in what we do as IBMers as we strive to be the catalyst that makes the world work better.
   

  

 Being an IBMer means you’ll be able to learn and develop yourself and your career, you’ll be encouraged to be courageous and experiment everyday, all whilst having continuous trust and support in an environment where everyone can thrive whatever their personal or professional background.
   

  

 Our IBMers are growth minded, always staying curious, open to feedback and learning new information and skills to constantly transform themselves and our company. They are trusted to provide on-going feedback to help other IBMers grow, as well as collaborate with colleagues keeping in mind a team focused approach to include different perspectives to drive exceptional outcomes for our customers. The courage our IBMers have to make critical decisions everyday is essential to IBM becoming the catalyst for progress, always embracing challenges with resources they have to hand, a can-do attitude and always striving for an outcome focused approach within everything that they do.
   

  

 Are you ready to be an IBMer?
   

  

**About IBM**
 IBM's greatest invention is the IBMer. We believe that through the application of intelligence, reason and science, we can improve business, society and the human condition, bringing the power of an open hybrid cloud and AI strategy to life for our clients and partners around the world.
   

  

 Restlessly reinventing since 1911, we are not only one of the largest corporate organizations in the world, we’re also one of the biggest technology and consulting employers, with many of the Fortune 50 companies relying on the IBM Cloud to run their business.
   

  

 At IBM, we pride ourselves on being an early adopter of artificial intelligence, quantum computing and blockchain. Now it’s time for you to join us on our journey to being a responsible technology innovator and a force for good in the world.
   

  

**Location Statement**
 IBM wants you to bring your whole self to work and for you this might mean the ability to work flexibly. If you are interested in a flexible working pattern, please talk to our recruitment team to find out if this is possible in the current working environment.
   

  

**Being You @ IBM**
 IBM is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal-opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, caste, genetics, pregnancy, disability, neurodivergence, age, veteran status, or other characteristics. IBM is also committed to compliance with all fair employment practices regarding citizenship and immigration status.

title: Social Media Content Creator (Temporary)
description:
*Benify is an international HR tech company that provides a market-leading global benefit and total rewards platform. With over 550* 
 Benifyers in 6 countries, we're driving success with over 1,600 customers and approximately three million users worldwide. We empower people to be their best while fostering a sustainable and engaging work culture where employees feel engaged and included, "Because People Matter" 💙.
   

  

**Social Media Content Creator** 
**(T** 
**emporary)**
 Are you a creative individual with a passion for social media and content creation? We are looking for a dynamic Social Media Content Creator to join our Marcom Department's digital team.
 ***T** 
**his is a temporary position for 7 months starting end of January.***
 In this role, you will be responsible for ensuring our brand's organic presence across various social media channels. You'll plan, produce, and publish engaging content, come up with innovative ideas for social posts, and design visually appealing creatives. Additionally, you'll track the performance of your content and evaluate its success to drive increased followers and engagement, all of which will be measured through our social platforms.
   

  

 You'll be working closely with our Digital Team, which consists of a Web/SEO Manager and a Digital Marketing Specialist (focused on paid media), and the Field Marketing team of five people. We also have a Creative team with two content writers who will assist you with the writing, and an Art Director who will guide you with the graphics.
   

  

**You Will**
* Plan, produce, and publish compelling content across all our social media channels.
* Ensure consistency and alignment with our brand voice and objectives.
* Collaborate closely with the Field Marketing team to integrate social media initiatives.
* Monitor and analyze content performance using social platform analytics.
* Track key metrics such as follower growth and engagement rates.
* Provide insights and recommendations to optimize future content strategies.


**Who we are looking for** 
 👀
   

  

 We are searching for someone with a background in digital content creation and social media management
 *.* 
 You should have:
   

  

* 1-2 years of managing social media accounts.
* A degree or certification in digital content creation (e.g., Photoshop, Adobe Suite).
* Proficiency in English, as it’s our corporate language, and Swedish, since our content is posted in Swedish.
* Experience with social media platforms, including LinkedIn and Meta.


**It's an extra plus if you have⭐**
* Experience with HubSpot or other CRM/social media management tools.
* Education in Digital Marketing — While not required, having a background in Digital Marketing would make you an even stronger candidate.
* Social Media experience working at a SaaS/tech company.


 To succeed in this role, we also see that you are organized, ensuring the right message and image are posted at the correct time. You possess creativity, vital for generating engaging content that resonates with the audience. Strong communication skills are essential, as crafting compelling copy is a key part of social media. However, you’ll collaborate closely with our content writers to make the copy happen.
   

  

 At Benify, every employee plays a crucial role in our success. We value and encourage your ideas, fostering an environment where you can grow. Your development is in your hands, driven by your initiative, curiosity, and passion — at Benify, the opportunities are limitless.
   

  

 If you want to know more about what it's like to work at Benify along with our benefits, please check out our careers page here👋.
   

  

**Practical information** 
**📝**
**Location:** 
 Stockholm (where the team today is located).
   

  

*For this role, we do not offer paid visa sponsorship.*
**Extent:** 
 Full-time temporary position from end of January until August 2025.
   

  

**Start:** 
 End of January!🤩
   

  

*Last day to apply is October 3rd.*
 Benify started in 2004 in Sweden with a goal to revolutionize the HR industry with a platform that would improve the lives of employees. Today, Benify is an independent, flexible, and agile global HR technology company, offering the market’s leading global benefits and total rewards platform.

title: Senior Cost Manager / Senior Quantity Surveyor - Data Center Projects
description:
**Company Description**
*Turner & Townsend have been at the forefront of Hyperscale data center development from the outset, delivering multi-billion Euros of construction each year globally.*
*With our global footprint and client base, we bring local market insight combined with our in-depth understanding of global trends, giving our clients confidence when entering new markets.*
*We know what it costs to procure, design, build and operate data centers in both established and emerging markets. We work with clients to deliver certainty and maximize their return on investment, delivering effective program management, project and cost management and project controls services.*
**Job Description**
* Oversee the entire cost management process, from initial budget development to final project closeout.
* Collaborate closely with project teams to accurately estimate costs, track expenses, and provide regular financial reports.
* Conduct comprehensive cost analyses and recommend strategies for optimizing project budgets.
* Evaluate bids, negotiate contracts, and ensure adherence to cost control measures.
* Proactively identify potential risks, propose mitigation strategies, and monitor their implementation.
* Foster strong relationships with subcontractors, suppliers, and other stakeholders to achieve cost efficiencies.


**Qualifications**
* Degree in Quantity Surveying, Construction Economics or related subjects
* Solid experience in cost management within the construction industry with Data Center projects.
* Proficiency in budget development, cost estimation, and financial analysis.
* Strong negotiation and contract management skills.
* Excellent attention to detail and the ability to work under pressure.
* Exceptional communication and interpersonal skills to collaborate effectively with diverse teams.


**Additional Information**
*Our inspired people share our vision and mission. We provide a great place to work, where each person has the opportunity and voice to affect change.*
*We want our people to succeed both in work and life. To support this we promote a healthy, productive and flexible working environment that respects work-life balance.*
*Turner & Townsend is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees and actively encourage applications from all sectors of the community.*
*Please find out more about us at* 
*www.turnerandtownsend.com/*
 Join our social media conversations for more information about Turner & Townsend and our exciting future projects:
   

  

 Twitter
   

  

 Instagram
   

  

 LinkedIn
   

  

*It is strictly against Turner & Townsend policy for candidates to pay any fee in relation to our recruitment process. No recruitment agency working with Turner & Townsend will ask candidates to pay a fee at any time.*
*Any unsolicited resumes/CVs submitted through our website or to Turner & Townsend personal e-mail accounts, are considered property of Turner & Townsend and are not subject to payment of agency fees. In order to be an authorised Recruitment Agency/Search Firm for Turner & Townsend, there must be a formal written agreement in place and the agency must be invited, by the Recruitment Team, to submit candidates for review.*

title: Relocate to Malta Dynamics 365 F&O Technical Architect (Big 4/D365FO)
description:
Our client’s Microsoft Business Solutions team is a Microsoft Gold Partner and leader in Microsoft software implementations for medium to large organisations, providing their clients with the ability to keep up with the ever-changing digital world by implementing Microsoft’s M365, Azure, Microsoft’s Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) and Customer Engagement (CE) software from the Microsoft Dynamics 365 (D365) software line.
   

  

**Role Overview**
 Our client’s Microsoft Business Solutions team is looking for a talented D365 F&O Technical Architect who will use their expertise and experience for the technical realisation of tasks based on functional designs in Microsoft Dynamics 365 Finance & Operations in particular building and testing new and existing functionalities. This is a dynamic and exciting opportunity to join a growing new business area within a market leading firm.
   

  

**Job Type:** 
 Full Time
   

  

**Work Place:** 
 Onsite
   

  

**Location:** 
 Malta, Europe (Relocate to Malta)
   

  

**Relocation** 
 : VISA & Relocation Package Included
   

  

**Requirements**
* A University graduate with a relevant degree within a computing or business discipline.
* A Microsoft Dynamics 365 F&O Core Certification and a Microsoft Dynamics 365 F&O Technical Certification would be considered as an asset.
* Minimum 6+ years’ experience working with Microsoft Dynamics AX and Microsoft Dynamics 365 F&O.
* Experience with all stages of Dynamics 365 FO Development
* A good understanding of best practices including code management (i.e. source control), unit testing methodologies and build processes
* Strong knowledge on X++
* Good knowledge of Life Cycle Services (LCS)
* Experience in using Azure DevOps such as source control, gated check-ins and pipelines.
* Understand Devops principles
* Knowledge of Automatic Testing Language (ATL) would be considered as an asset
* Data migration (Data entities) experience in-line with D365FO data handling processes
* Experience with interfaces (SOAP, REST, custom services) would be considered as an asset
* Team player, able to foster positive working relationships across the organisation
* Resilience and ability to work in rapidly changing environment
* High sense of ownership and competence to work independently
* Willing to travel abroad when required


**Responsibilities**
* Work alongside the Solution and Senior Technical Architects to help create high quality design and sustainable client solutions and project documentation;
* Implementation of technical solutions for customer requirements in D365FO
* Analyse and resolve issues within the ERP system
* Participate in development, integrations, product support, and platform updates
* Write and manage technical documents
* Ensuring all design/technical documentation is kept up to date during the development process
* Working in an Agile approach depending on the business requirements
* Working with both on-shore and off/near-shore development teams
* Deliver all development work as per Microsoft Business Solutions (MBS) standards, ensuring that all software applications are implemented successfully per the project plan: on time and on budget;
* Be an active member of technical and design working groups within the practice
* Adhere to best practice and our clients technical standards during all development
* Keep team and project Manager updated with progress
* Perform code reviews.
* Help and mentor developers.
* Assisting in Technical Interviews.
* Identify any risks and issues early and raise through the appropriate governance channels
* To carry out additional duties as may occur from time to time as instructed and agreed by the Practice management team.
* Represent MBS in a professional and positive manner at all times.
* The Employee is required to follow our clients Information Security Policies (ISP and ISMP) at all times.


**Microsoft Business Solutions Overview**
 At our client, your long-term future is every bit as important to them as it is to you. That’s why our clients aim is to give you experiences that will stay with you for a lifetime. Whether it’s great training and development, mobility opportunities or corporate responsibility volunteering activities – you’ll gain a wealth of experiences on which to build a rewarding career. They are a firm that encourages you to be yourself, values your contribution, and inspires you to act as a role model, always focused on doing the right thing for each other, their clients, and their communities.
   

  

 This sets out all the different ways you’ll be rewarded by our client. Among other things, you can benefit from honest conversations about your career as well as a range of other rewards. In all these ways and more, they have created an environment that can bring out the best in you.
   

  

 #Bethechange and #makethechange. Join our clients' talented, successful team and make the leap into the future.
   

  

 For this exciting opportunity they have put together a great package that combines a competitive salary with a bundle of extras including allowances, business travel allowances, certifications to support you in your career growth, private insurance, and medical insurance for you and your family.
   

  

 Don’t worry, they know that relocation can be a challenge, which is why they have an extremely supportive onboarding team to help you throughout this process! - They provide relocation support for you and your family.

title: Systemförvaltare sökes till längre uppdrag hos kund
Senior System Developer till Atlas Antibodies AB
Senior Partner Sales Manager, Partner Sales Team
description:
**Description**
 AWS Sales, Marketing, and Global Services (SMGS) is responsible for driving revenue, adoption, and growth from the largest and fastest growing small- and mid-market accounts to enterprise-level customers including public sector.
   

  

 Would you like to be part of a team that is redefining the IT industry? Amazon Web Services is leading the next paradigm shift in computing and is looking for exceptional candidates to help drive our go-to-market with the leading partners in EMEA.
   

  

 As a Senior Partner Sales Manager, you will have the exciting opportunity to deliver on our strategy to build mind share and adoption of Amazon’s infrastructure web services across AWS’ key consulting partners and their customers in the Enterprise segment. You will be an integral part of the Enterprise Sales organization and responsible for working with cross-functional teams to create and execute a strategic partner sales plan for Enterprise, drive top line revenue growth and end customer adoption through partner engagement. The ideal candidate has both a business background that enables them engage at the CXO level, and a sales background that enables them to easily interact with customers and account management. You should have a demonstrated ability to think strategically about business, product, and technical challenges, with the ability to build and convey compelling value propositions with partners.
   

  

 Key job responsibilities
   

  

**You Will Be Expected To**
* Have a holistic view of the Partner Community in EMEA, a deep understanding of the partner capabilities and solutions that will delight customers.
* Advise customers and commercial sales teams on the value of partners, engagement and recommend qualified partners to support customer needs.
* Expand existing AWS footprint as well as drive new customer engagements with partners to grow overall revenue with a focus on business outcomes.
* Become a trusted member of the sales team to own deal execution with partners, leveraging Partner programs and coaching partners on best practices.
* Work closely with Partner Solution Architects (PSA) to ensure partners deliver quality results and work with Partner Development Managers (PDM) on engaging their partners in the local market


**About The Team**
 Diverse Experiences
   

  

 Amazon values diverse experiences. Even if you do not meet all of the preferred qualifications and skills listed in the job description, we encourage candidates to apply. If your career is just starting, hasn’t followed a traditional path, or includes alternative experiences, don’t let it stop you from applying.
   

  

 Why AWS
   

  

 Amazon Web Services (AWS) is the world’s most comprehensive and broadly adopted cloud platform. We pioneered cloud computing and never stopped innovating — that’s why customers from the most successful startups to Global 500 companies trust our robust suite of products and services to power their businesses.
   

  

 Work/Life Balance
   

  

 We value work-life harmony. Achieving success at work should never come at the expense of sacrifices at home, which is why flexible work hours and arrangements are part of our culture. When we feel supported in the workplace and at home, there’s nothing we can’t achieve in the cloud.
   

  

 Inclusive Team Culture
   

  

 Here at AWS, it’s in our nature to learn and be curious. Our employee-led affinity groups foster a culture of inclusion that empower us to be proud of our differences. Ongoing events and learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences, inspire us to never stop embracing our uniqueness.
   

  

 Mentorship and Career Growth
   

  

 We’re continuously raising our performance bar as we strive to become Earth’s Best Employer. That’s why you’ll find endless knowledge-sharing, mentorship and other career-advancing resources here to help you develop into a better-rounded professional.
   

  

**Basic Qualifications**
* Strong experience in end-customer sales in the cloud business or in the software industry
* Successful track-record (exceeding quota and key performance metrics) with consulting or technology partners through account management, program management and business development
* Experience engaging and influencing senior executives and excellent familiarity with Enterprise customer decision making processes
* Effective verbal and written communications skills, excellent presentation skills and ability to articulate complex concepts to cross-functional audiences
* Business fluency in at least one EMEA language


**Preferred Qualifications**
* Prior experience working with AWS Consulting Partners and/or Technology partners
* Understanding of AWS, cloud architecture and infrastructure
* Strong organizational skills and attention-to-detail with the ability to set clear priorities in a fast paced, dynamic work environment
* An entrepreneurial spirit, including the ability to work independently and autonomously
* Experience within the Enterprise software development industry and/or IT outsourcing


 Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build. Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice (https://www.amazon.jobs/en/privacy\_page) to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates.
   

  

  

**Company** 
 - AWS EMEA SARL (Sweden Branch)

title: Traffic Compliance Specialist
description:
**About The Opportunity**
**Got a knack for logistics and want to ensure smooth operations? Foodora is looking for a Traffic Compliance Specialist (Trafikansvarig) to oversee our transport activities and ensure compliance with Swedish laws. This important role involves keeping Foodora’s deliveries safe and efficient. Ready to take the lead? Apply today!**
**Your mission**
* Oversee Foodora’s transport operations to ensure compliance with Swedish legal standards.
* Manage daily updates of the vehicle fleet, including registering and deregistering vehicles to ensure they are permitted for commercial deliveries.
* Act as the Point of Contact for our e-car operations, collaborating with entities like Abax, CarValoo, Däckia, Insurance providers, and Bilbörsen. You will manage projects related to utilization, training materials, and cost optimization for e-cars.
* Liaise between stakeholders for ad-bikes, including KAMs, AMs, Marketing, Sales, and logistics, ensuring ads are implemented on time and to a high standard.
* Lead the light e-vehicles project, maintaining relationships with GoCiklo and overseeing pricing, costs, and fleet expansion efforts.
* Participate in ongoing projects such as battery swap initiatives, Foodora driving school, and partnerships that benefit our riders.


 We are looking for a true Foodorian who loves the hustle and bustle of a fast-paced environment and isn't afraid to push boundaries. To excel in this role, you need to be both
 **energetic and driven** 
 , with a structured approach to tackling challenges. We believe that success comes from
 **proactive initiative** 
 , so being an initiator who can spot opportunities for growth is key. Your
 **analytical** 
 skills will help you make data-driven decisions and continuously improve our processes. As you'll be interacting with various stakeholders, your knack for
 **building strong relationships** 
 will be essential to achieving outstanding results.
   

  

 Our selection process is continuous and the ad may close before the recruitment process is completed, if we’ve moved forward to the screening or interview phase.
   

  

**Our recruitment process will include the following:**
 📞 Telephone interview - Let’s cover the basics!
   

  

 💡 Psychometric tests via Alva Labs - We use science-based methodology.
   

  

 🤝 First interview - Time to know each other a bit better!
   

  

 💼 Case interview - Do your magic and show us your skills!
   

  

 ✔ ️ Reference- & background check - Final step before we’ll become colleagues.
   

  

**Start date:** 
 Upon agreement
   

  

**What you need to be successful**
* Experience in managing transport operations or working in a logistics-related role
* Experience or genuine interest in big data breakdown and data analysis, SQL
* Knowledge of Swedish transport laws and regulations (or willingness to quickly learn them)
* Strong organizational skills and the ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously
* Possess or are prepared to obtain approved tests of “yrkeskunnande för yrkesmässig trafik” at Trafikverket
* Fluent in both Swedish and English
* Driver license is a plus


 Studies have shown that women and some minorities are less likely to apply to jobs unless they meet every qualification. If you are interested in this role and you have most of the skills we’re looking for, we encourage you to apply anyway!
   

  

**Who we are**
 ABOUT FOODORA: foodora is a quick commerce and delivery company, present in six countries in Europe - Austria, Czech, Hungary, Finland, Norway and Sweden. With the mission to deliver an amazing, fast and affordable experience, foodora aims to give customers more time to focus on what matters most to them, as well as growing along with their partners, riders and community along the way. foodora is part of Delivery Hero, a pioneer quick commerce company, building the next generation of e-commerce across its operations in over 70 countries across Asia, Europe, Latin America, the Middle East and Africa.
   

  

 For more information, please visit www.foodora.com
   

  

 foodora is part of the Delivery Hero Group, the world’s leading local delivery platform operating in 70+ countries worldwide
   

  

**What's in it for you**
* Wellness allowance topped with the opportunity to participate in many work/life balance initiatives at foodora such as free group training at Sats & reduced price on massage.
* Employee discount at foodora (woho!) and awesome friday breakfasts!
* Occupational pension, incl. premium exemption insurance, accident insurance and life insurance.
* foodora Learning - Monthly learning sessions about different topics, such as the q-commerce industry, negotiation techniques and project management combined with a structured onboarding and inspiring courses within our learning tool Sana
* Great deals at Benify (for e.g. gym membership, e-bikes hotels, audiobooks, streaming services, clothes, kitchen supplies… and so much more!
* Awesome AW’s and (pink) parties!

title: Byggledare drift & underhåll
description:
Centio är ett familjärt konsultbolag som strävar efter att tillsammans med våra kunder främja en hållbar samhällsutveckling. Med verksamhet över hela Sverige erbjuder vi expertis inom områden som ekonomi, inköp, administration, projektledning, tekniska tjänster och IT.
   

  

 Våra medarbetare är engagerade individer som brinner för samhällsutveckling. Som en decentraliserad organisation arbetar vi i små, självstyrande team där medarbetarna har stort beslutsmandat. Detta ger varje individ möjlighet till både stort ansvar och frihet att själv påverka sitt arbete, sin personliga utveckling och arbetstiderna. Det som förenar oss är vår gemensamma vision att göra positiv skillnad i samhället och samtidigt ha roligt på resan!
   

  

 Vi söker en Byggledare inriktning drift, underhåll och trafiksignaler till mångårigt uppdrag i Göteborg.
   

  

 Detta är ett konsultuppdrag. Du kommer vara anställd av Centio Consulting Group AB och arbeta som konsult.
   

  

 Uppdraget innebär ett nära samarbete med kunden vilket ställer stora krav på flexibilitet och samarbetsförmåga.
   

  

**Uppdraget**
 Uppdragsgivaren söker efter en byggledare med dokumenterad erfarenhet av trafiksignaler för ett mångårigt uppdrag. Utöver byggledning så ingår det även i uppdraget att ta fram material som ska användas till förfrågningsunderlag för upphandling av drift- och underhåll och investeringsprojekt avseende trafiksignaler.
   

  

**Krav (OBS, obligatoriska)**
 Ska ha minst 5 års erfarenhet av arbete inom trafiksignalbranschen.
   

  

 Ska minst ha genomfört ett (1) uppdrag eller ha ett (1) pågående uppdrag i rollen som
   

  

 byggledare, projektledare eller motsvarande, de senaste 3 åren.
   

  

 Ovan uppdrag ska ha gällt för ombyggnads- eller drift- och underhållsentreprenader där minst 30 st trafiksignalanläggningar ingått.
   

  

 Ha utbildning i grundläggande ellära.
   

  

 Relevant högskoleutbildning/högskolekurser.
   

  

 Kännedom om DV8, Trafikverkets signalreglering med Lhovrateknik
   

  

**Om oss**
 Centios övergripande mål är att vara ett konsultbolag som erbjuder smarta och hållbara lösningar som utvecklar samhället på ett positivt sätt.
   

  

 Våra medarbetare erbjuds villkor som är anpassade för individen. Det innebär att arbetstider, arbetsomfattning, arbetsplats och kompetensutveckling så långt som möjligt anpassas utifrån medarbetarens behov.
   

  

 Bland våra medarbetare hittar du engagerad personer som brinner för samhällsutveckling. Vi jobbar i små grupper där du kan bidra med dina erfarenheter samtidigt som du får ta del av andras kunskap och erfarenhet.
   

  

 För oss är det viktigt med välmående och att hitta en sund balans mellan arbete och fritid. Därför har vi en nollvision mot stress och sätter trivsel och hälsa främst.
   

  

 Läs gärna mer om oss på centio.se.
   

  

**Vänligen skicka ditt CV på svenska.**
 Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!

title: Saleshub & Business Controller
description:
As a Saleshub & Business Controller at Orange Business, you will be a pivotal member of our Business Control team. The team is focused on managing financial data and business processes for Norway, Sweden, and Germany within the areas for business intelligence, controlling and sales support.
 



  





 The team play a key role in providing critical data for invoicing, reporting, detailed analysis, and informed decision-making across the organization. The team is spread between mainly Sweden, Norway and Germany, but will expand over time.
 



  





 The role as Saleshub & Business Controller involve two main focuses. The current primary focus – and what will require the larger part of your attention, will be focused on being the go-to person for the sales organization in using the CRM system and as the instrumental person in ensuring accurate registration in our billing system through collaboration with the delivery teams. Meanwhile the other area of focus will be to use your expertise to contribute to conduct insightful analyses on behalf of the management team.
 



  





 If you thrive on combining analytical work with regular processes, this position is perfect for you. We are looking for an independent, proactive individual who confidently reaches out and asks questions. While you will have a strong support from your team and close collaboration with the Saleshub and the Business Controllers for the other countries, it is essential that you enjoy operating independently.
 



  





  





**Your key areas of responsibility as Saleshub & Business Controller:** 




  




* Submitting change orders on behalf of service managers in billing tool & ensure they deliver satisfactory tickets
* Monitor bookings & pipeline in Salesforce
* Calculate provision achievements for Key Account Managers
* Follow up booked revenues, but not billed
* Business review with customer teams monthly & support Business Managers in monitoring hour registration
* Be the Go-to person in customer finance related questions
* Ensure change documents to contracts are uploaded to confluence/house of control
* Help out on Ad-hoc projects and improvement processes
* Run price adjustment processes, and analyze effects of this
* Helping out with calculations in larger bids & ensure bid processes are followed



  





**As an ideal candidate you have the following:** 




  





 Education and experience:
 


* Bachelor's degree in Finance, Business Administration, or related field
* A minimum of 3 years experience in advanced controlling
* Experience from B2B sales support and CRM system management



  





 Technical Skills:
 


* Expert-level skills in Microsoft Excel and PowerBI or other similar BI-tools
* Strong understanding of data warehouse concepts and business intelligence tools



  





 Analytical and Financial Acumen:
 


* Demonstrated ability to conduct complex financial analyses and provide actionable insights
* Experience from working with pricing strategies and bid calculations for large-scale projects



  





 Process Management:
 


* Proven ability to manage and optimize sales and billing processes
* Experience in contract management and documentation



  





 Communication and Training:
 


* Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English and Swedish
* Ability to effectively train staff on financial systems and reporting tools
* Experience in presenting to management and cross-functional teams



  





 Personal Attributes:
 


* Strong independent work ethic with the ability to manage multiple priorities
* Proactive problem-solving approach and attention to detail
* Adaptability to work in a dynamic, fast-paced environment across multiple countries



  





  





**What we offer you:** 




  




* Hybrid ways of working with access to our modern & collaborative office in Stockholm
* We may work with tomorrow’s technology, but at our core we are a people-oriented organization and we are proud to have our Great Place to Work certification
* An open and inclusive culture, that enables us to reach our full potential
* A community of experts - as Digital Natives, we put innovation at the heart of our expertise
* Read more about the benefits we offer
 **here** 
 .



  





**About Orange Business:** 




  





 Orange Business is a leading network and digital integrator company with offices in 65 countries worldwide, and part of the Orange Group.
 



  





 Digital Services, a business line of Orange Business is a newly created division within Orange Business. In Europe the business line consists of approximately 1500 people distributed across 9 countries. We are digital natives, with innovation at the core of our business, which makes us a reliable partner close to our customers. Our joint mission is to help innovate, drive and lead them in their digital transformation challenges and business strategies in key digital domains, including Cloud, Customer Experience, Digital Workspace and Data & AI. As an agile and fast-moving digital business partner, the business line offers trusted end-to-end solutions and products that help businesses in a wide range of industries in the private and public sector transform their operations, enhance customer experience, and drive growth.
 



 With our digital expertise, we are a strategic partner of Orange Business objectives to be a leading network and digital integrator with our team as a key growth engine.
 



  





**The process:** 




  





 We screen applications on an ongoing basis, with the aim of conducting conversations and interviews as we receive them.
 



  





 Interested but feel that you don´t match the criteria 100%? We encourage you to apply anyway! We believe in the potential of diverse skill sets, perspectives and individuality. We want to encourage everyone to be their authentic selves and your unique capabilities may align perfectly with our team's needs! Your perfect match might be the next job we are announcing, so why not have a head start and apply now!
 



  





 Are you interested to read more about Orange Business? Visit our
 **Website** 
 or follow our
 **LinkedIn** 
 account.

title: Field Marketing Program Manager - EMEA (M/F/D)
description:
**Job Description**
 Agilent inspires and supports discoveries that advance the quality of life. We provide life science, diagnostic and applied market laboratories worldwide with instruments, services, consumables, applications and expertise. Agilent enables customers to gain the answers and insights they seek, so they can do what they do best: improve the world around us. Information about Agilent is available at agilent.com.
   

  

**Role Overview**
 As a
 **Marketing Program Manager (MPM)** 
 you will be responsible for defining, designing and drives the development of effective regional marketing programs in alignment with the regional business strategy to support customer acquisition, funnel growth and revenue generation for Agilent’s pathology business. Advocate for customers through an intentional customer-first approach and champion brand.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Partners with regional sales leaders to identify regional business priorities and initiatives and develops regional Marketing Program Strategy to support those.
* Contributes to global Marketing Programs Strategy representing the regional needs and opportunities. Augments regional impact of global marketing campaign by increasing internal awareness and complementing with regional activities where appropriate.
* Works with the regional Sales channels to monitor & analyze competitive information and customer data to facilitate effective program development and drive activities to drive higher volume and quality of funnel.
* Serves as point of contact for the regional sales channels for Solution Unit requests and reciprocally provides the field perspective to the Solution Unit.
* Collaborates with peers to integrate program strategies cross-portfolio to align with customer needs along the buyer’s journey
* Works closely with the EMEA Marketing communication specialist team to develop program metrics & effective tactics mix. Measures and evaluates short- and long-term impact and ROI against goals; implements adjustments as required
* Accountable for meeting Marketing Program Budget quarterly targets
* Ensures campaign related content meets regulatory, medical and legal approvals as required
* Responsible for defining channel training requirements linked to program execution.


**Qualifications**
* Bachelor’s degree or master’s in Pathology/Genomics/ molecular biology/ biochemistry/ biology/medical science or equivalent
* Background in Pathology (through education or field experience): 3-5 years’ experience within Pathology/Hematology/Genomics business, preferably with 2 years in sales and/or marketing.
* Strong knowledge of the Pathology technologies and good understanding of primarily the clinical market within EMEA.
* Desirable International business experience in a marketing role in pathology/hematology/genomics
* Effective project management and organizational skills
* Professional and positive approach, self-motivated, team player, dynamic, creative with the ability to work on own initiative
* Demonstrated skills in teamwork, results-orientation, and strong persistence to reach goals.
* Demonstrates strong oral and written communication skills (English) including the ability to clearly present recommendations and ideas to summarize complex issues
* Must have a proven ability to plan and execute; to think strategically and translate to tactics that can be implemented to drive customer preference and demand for Agilent’s solutions.
* Ability to deal with high pressure, visibility, and workload; Willingness to prioritize tasks and make quick decisions.
* Ability to collaborate equally effectively throughout all hierarchical levels and work across a matrixed and global organization. Ability to influence and persuade across all levels of a global organization.
* Business related computer skills including knowledge with PowerPoint, Excel, Teams, Google Analytics, and various CRM software solutions
* Willingness for travel for ~ 25% of the time.


**We offer:**
* An opportunity for you to make a significant impact in a world-class company and develop your skills
* A role among passionate colleagues, in a growth orientated and inclusive environment. You will become part of a caring and fast paced environment, built on integrity, sharing and trust
* Competitive compensation and benefits package
* Work-Life-Balance programs
* Company pension scheme, yearly company bonus, private health care, stock purchase plan, medical & life insurance...


**We will make sure you get all the training and development opportunities you need to become the best in your field!**
**Additional Details**
 This job has a full time weekly schedule. It includes the option to work remotely.
   

  

 Our pay ranges are determined by role, level, and location. Within the range, individual pay is determined by work location and additional factors, including job-related skills, experience, and relevant education or training. During the hiring process, a recruiter can share more about the specific pay range for a preferred location. Pay and benefit information by country are available at: https://careers.agilent.com/locations
   

  

 Agilent Technologies Inc. is an equal opportunity employer. title: Senior systemutvecklare inom SharePoint OnPrem
description:
Vill du ha ett tryggt och långsiktigt jobb, där balansen i livet tas på allvar? Som senior systemutvecklare hos oss få du möjlighet till detta samtidigt som du också får ett roligt och utvecklande jobb!
   

  

**Arbetsuppgifter**
 Vi söker nu en senior systemutvecklare på SharePoint OnPrem till vårt Ramverksteam för SharePoint på Trafikverket. Detta ramverk används sedan av alla andra SharePoint Applikationer på Trafikverket. Du kommer till största del fokusera på nyutveckling och förvaltning av SharePoint OnPrem applikationer där du ingår i ett agilt team med 6 andra personer. Du kommer även arbeta med att:
   

  

* skapa finurliga lösningar vid både nyutveckling och refactoring där varje bidrag påverkar tiotusentals användares möjlighet att bygga och underhålla både vägar och järnvägar
* migrera SharePoint applikationer med tiotusentals användare från SP2016 till SharePoint Server Edition (SPSE) OnPrem
* bidra till ett stort säkerhetstänk där du ser utmaningen med att inte kunna använda molnlösningar, men är samtidigt redo att gå mot interna lösningar med kubernetes och docker lite längre fram


 På SharePoint OnPrem är vår framtida strategi att migrera till SPSE nu under 2024, och sedan 2025 gå till Modern, där man har större möjligheter att bygga saker ovanpå SPSE i andra språk, t.ex. React. Vi går också mot att minska de specialsydda lösningarna direkt på SharePoint OnPrem och istället börja använda oss av olika självbetjäningstjänster ovanpå SharePoint OnPrem skrivna i andra programmeringsspråk.
   

  

**Några ord från din potentiellt blivande chef:**
*Jag har själv en bakgrund som senior systemutvecklare och som ledare tror jag starkt på att ge mina utvecklare en god social samvaro, rimliga individuella förutsättningar att göra sitt jobb, autonomi och möjlighet att vidareutvecklas i den riktning som intresserar var och en. Jag anser mig lyckats som din chef när du mår bra och trivs på jobbet.*
**Vad kan vi erbjuda dig?**
 Trafikverket ser positivt på kompetenshöjande utveckling och hos oss får du en unik möjlighet att vidareutbilda sig inom andra programmeringsspråk och roller som du sedan får arbetserfarenhet inom din nya roll eller programmeringsspråk inom Trafikverket. Vi erbjuder också en väldigt bra balans mellan arbete och fritid på sektionen. Vi har endast övertid vid driftsättningar, som sker några gånger per år, och normalt vardagseftermiddagar.
   

  

**Kvalifikationer**
**Vem är du?**
 Som person har du god analytisk problemlösningsförmåga, motiveras av ett aktivt medarbetarskap där du på ett målmedvetet sätt tar ansvar för dina arbetsuppgifter samtidigt som du är uppmärksam på hur du är en del av och bidrar till helheten genom att samverka med andra. Vidare har du initiativförmåga och letar aktivt upp informationen du behöver för att lösa dina kodproblem. Du har god samarbetsförmåga, lyssnar in på lösningsförslag från andra i ditt team, trivs med att programmera i par, agerar gärna mentor till andra utvecklare och ha en dialog med arkitekt och slutanvändare. Du arbetar strukturerat och är självgående i form av att du dokumenterar ditt arbete noggrant och planerar din tid för att driva ditt egna arbete framåt.
   

  

**Vi söker dig som har**
* relevant högskole- eller civilingenjörsexamen om minst 180hp (120 p) med inriktning IT eller annan utbildning i kombination med erfarenhet i närtid som bedöms likvärdig (detta omfattar t,ex 2 år yrkeshögskola + arbetslivserfarenhet inom systemutveckling)
* minst 5 års erfarenhet av systemutveckling
* minst 2 års arbetslivserfarenhet av systemutveckling i SharePoint OnPrem 2016 eller senare
* arbetslivserfarenhet av systemutveckling i .NET eller C#
* relevant arbetslivserfarenhet av mentorskap för andra systemutvecklare
* goda kunskaper i svenska i tal och skrift


**Det är meriterande om du har**
* arbetslivserfarenhet av PowerShell
* arbetslivserfarenhet av React
* arbetslivserfarenhet av systemutveckling i SPSE
* arbetslivserfarenhet av Scrum som arbetsmetodik
* arbetslivserfarenhet av Azure DevOps eller Jira eller motsvarande ärendehanteringssystem med integration mot kodbaser och releasehantering


**Övrig information**
 Möjliga placeringsorter för denna tjänst är: Borlänge, Göteborg, Malmö, Stockholm eller Örebro.
   

  

 I denna rekrytering kan webbaserade tester och/eller arbetsprov förekomma som en del i urvalet. Intervjuer sker digitalt via Skype och är planerade att genomföras under vecka 46. I denna tjänst finns det möjlighet att arbeta hemifrån upp till 40 procent av din arbetstid. Vi använder främst mail (från mejladress: noreply@heroma.se) för att göra utskick och kallelser. Kolla din inkorg och även skräppost/SPAM regelbundet under denna tid för att vara säker på att du får all information från oss! För att undvika att information gällande din ansökan klassas som SPAM kan du med fördel lägga till vår e-postadress: noreply@heroma.se i dina e-postkontakter.
   

  

**Ansökan**
 De frågor som du får besvara när du skickar in din ansökan kommer att ligga till grund för det första urvalet vi gör. Om det inte står något annat i annonsen vill vi att du bifogar ditt CV. Vi har slutat begära in personligt brev eftersom vi inte har med det som del av urvalsunderlaget.
   

  

 Inom vår IT-organisation är du med och utvecklar Sverige med hjälp av moderna och innovativa lösningar. Vi är mitt i en spännande förändring där vi försöker ta vara på digitaliseringens möjligheter till fullo. Digitaliseringen ställer allt större krav och vi vill därför anpassa oss vad gäller kompetens, arbetssätt och organisation i takt med utvecklingen. Vi har ett helhetsansvar för IT och telekom, en verksamhet som pågår dygnet runt, året om - precis som Sveriges transportsystem.
   

  

 På Trafikverket jobbar vi med att göra Sverige närmare. Vi tror på att en förening av olika erfarenheter, bakgrunder och perspektiv är den bästa grunden för att bygga en arbetsplats fri från diskriminering och en miljö där alla trivs och gör sitt bästa. Vi tror på mångfald där den gemensamma nämnaren är pålitlighet, engagemang och mod. För det är så vi bäst representerar vårt samhälle.

title: Costing and Productivity Specialist
description:
*Var 660:e person som går till arbetet i Sverige är en ISS-medarbetare och det är vi stolta över. Vi är ett av Sveriges och Nordens största tjänsteföretag samt har över 450 000 medarbetare världen över. Det är våra medarbetare som är kärnan i vår verksamhet och förutsättningen för att kunna leva upp till vårt syfte, Connecting people and places to make the world work better. På ISS Facility Services skapar vi platser och miljöer som bidrar till bättre prestationer och en enklare, mer effektiv och trivsam tillvaro - levererade med omtanke och hög kvalitet av engagerade medarbetare. Vill du också bli en del i vår globala organisation där ditt jobb verkligen gör skillnad?*
**Är du skicklig med siffror och brinner för analys? Är du redo för en spännande och affärsnära roll? Då kan du vara den vi söker som Costing and Productivity Specialist till ISS!**
**Om rollen**
 I rollen som Costing and Productivity Specialist på ISS kommer du vara en nyckelspelare i vår kommersiella organisation i Sverige. Du kommer fokusera på kalkylering och analys inom flera parallella anbudsprocesser och affärsutvecklingsprojekt, med huvudansvar för kostnadsberäkningar inom lokalvård. Det är en affärsnära position där du blir en viktig del av ISS tillväxtresa och har möjlighet till individuell utveckling både inom Sverige och globalt.
   

  

 Dina ansvarsområden inkluderar att:
   

  

* Delta i flera offentliga och privata anbudsprocesser med ansvar för kostnadsberäkningar av lokalvård
* Ta fram lösningsförslag till kund under anbudsprocessen
* Arbeta i Excel
* Initiera, delta och driva olika utvecklingsarbeten, inklusive nyckeltalsutveckling och verktygsoptimering
